On 1/4/07, Michael Stack <stack@...> wrote:
>
>
>
> A better source would be the crawl.log.   Does it have multiple
>  instances of the said 'index.html' page, with or without parameters?  If
>  not, then its likely an issue with the mirrorwriter processor.

I already deleted the job, so I had to do it again. It is still
running at the moment but there's nothing in the crawl.log, not even
about http://www.telegraaf.nl/index.html. I used the regular
expression: .*http://www.telegraaf.nl/index.*

When I check in the mirror directory there is one index.html file and
already 27000 indexr=1015671205&.html files.

-rw-r--r--   1 breedj users 141K 2007-01-05 10:51 indexr=1015671205&.html
-rw-r--r--   1 breedj users 124K 2007-01-05 08:02 indexr=1016692205&.html
-rw-r--r--   1 breedj users 128K 2007-01-05 01:18 indexr=1016713526&.html
-rw-r--r--   1 breedj users 145K 2007-01-05 13:24 indexr=1017088311&.html
-rw-r--r--   1 breedj users 128K 2007-01-05 06:41 indexr=1017109631&.html
-rw-r--r--   1 breedj users 126K 2007-01-04 22:57 indexr=1017548377&.html
-rw-r--r--   1 breedj users 128K 2007-01-05 02:40 indexr=1018361908&.html
-rw-r--r--   1 breedj users 149K 2007-01-05 14:46 indexr=1018736693&.html
-rw-r--r--   1 breedj users 127K 2007-01-05 08:02 indexr=1018758014&.html

It's propably easy to reproduce.

Thanks and regards,

Jeroen
